section.name: LoggerAppenderMailEvent
section.p: LoggerAppenderMailEvent appends individual log events via email.
This appender is similar to LoggerAppenderMail, except that it sends each each log event in an individual email message at the time when it occurs.

subsection.name: Layout
subsection.p: This appender requires a layout. If no layout is specified in configuration, LoggerLayoutSimple will be used by default.

tr.td: Email address(es) to which the log will be sent. Multiple email addresses may be specified by separating them with a comma.
Email address which will be used in the From field.
Used to override the SMTP server. Only works on Windows.
Used to override the default SMTP server port. Only works on Windows.

subsection.name: Examples
subsection.p: This example shows how to configure LoggerAppenderMailEvent to send the log to two email addresses.

div.pre: <configuration xmlns="http://logging.apache.org/log4php/"> <appender name="default" class="LoggerAppenderMailEvent"> <layout class="LoggerLayoutSimple" /> <param name="to" value="foo@example.com,baz@example.com" /> <param name="from" value="logger@example.com" /> </appender> <root> <appender_ref ref="default" /> </root> </configuration>
